subtitle: In this expanded heart meditation, you can allow
your energetic or loving heart to expand as big
as you would like it to be. Go ahead and get
comfortable either seated or lying down in an
area free of distractions. Bring your awareness
to your breath. Notice how you are breathing.
Take a slow, gentle, deep breath in, allowing
the abdomen to expand out and then letting it
come back toward your body with each breath out.
So breathing in, the abdomen expands and breathing
out it comes back toward your body. Notice how
you're feeling in your body. Notice how you're
feeling in your mind. How are you feeling in your
heart? How are your emotions? With each breath
out, letting any tension or stress you may be
holding in your mind, your body, your emotions,
to just simply and gently be released into the
earth, letting go of any trying or striving to
make anything happen. Allow yourself to connect
with love. You may find it helpful to think of
something or someone whom you love. This may include yourself.
Allow this feeling of love to expand through your whole being and body.
You may wish to say, I love you. Allow yourself
to connect with the feeling of gratitude, a sense
of gratefulness and thankfulness. You may find it
helpful to think of something or someone for which
you're grateful.
Allow a feeling of gratefulness to expand through
your whole being and body. You may wish to say,
thank you. Connect with the feeling of joy, a
sense of levity, happiness, or contentment. You
may find it helpful to think of something or
someone who brings you joy. You may find it
helpful to think of a happy or pleasant moment.
Allow this feeling of joy to expand through your
whole being and body. Allow yourself to connect
with compassion, the ability to feel another's
sorrow, pain, suffering, or joy. This may include
yourself with a sincere desire for you or them
to feel better. Allow this feeling of compassion
to expand through your whole being, body, and
beyond, perhaps sending light and love to yourself
or their way. You may wish to say, I feel you and
I understand. Allow yourself to connect with
forgiveness. Who do you need to forgive?
Yourself? Others?
Allow this feeling of forgiveness to expand
through your whole being and body, recognizing,
I am doing the best I can, or they were doing
the best they could. What may you have learned
from this experience? When you're ready, forgive yourself, forgive others.
Find the light in your heart. This can be a bright
white light or golden light. It can be any color.
It can be like a campfire or a crystal chandelier.
It may be the sun or the stars. Feel that light
in your heart. Feel this light expanding,
permeating into every tissue and cell in your body,
allowing it to expand past your physical body a
foot or more or as far as you would like it to go.
Allow it to expand as big as is comfortable
for you. Feel this light. You are this light.
You are this love. Where would you like this
light and love to go to? A close loved one?
Yourself? A friend or family member? Your
community? City? Country? The whole world or beyond?
What would happen if the whole world or beyond felt your expanded heart?
What would happen for you? What would happen for all of us?
Spend as much time as you would like feeling your expanding heart.
Love, compassion, gratitude, joy, forgiveness
as you would like. Thank you for being with me.
